00027 /*
00028  * USBHEP_CtrlEpHandler() is called each time a packet has been transmitted
00029  * or recieved on host channels serving a device default endpoint (EP0).
00030  * A state machine navigate us through the phases of a control transfer
00031  * according to "chapter 9" in the USB spec.
00032  */
00033 void USBHEP_CtrlEpHandler( USBH_Ep_TypeDef *ep, USB_Status_TypeDef result )
00034 {
00035 uint8_t direction;
00036 
00037   switch ( ep->state )
00038   {
00039     /* ------- Setup stage ------------------------------------------------ */
00040     case H_EP_SETUP:                      /* SETUP packet sent successfully */
00041       if ( result == USB_STATUS_OK )
00042       {
00043         direction = ep->setup.bmRequestType & USB_SETUP_DIR_MASK;
00044 
00045         /* Check if there is a data stage */
00046         if ( ep->setup.wLength != 0 )
00047         {
00048           if ( direction == USB_SETUP_DIR_D2H )   /* Data direction is IN */
00049           {
00050             USBH_CtlReceiveData( ep, ep->setup.wLength );
00051             ep->state = H_EP_DATA_IN;
00052             break;
00053           }
00054           else                                    /* Data direction is OUT */
00055           {
00056             USBH_CtlSendData( ep, ep->setup.wLength );
00057             ep->state = H_EP_DATA_OUT;
00058             break;
00059           }
00060         }
00061         USBH_CtlReceiveData( ep, 0 );   /* No data stage */
00062         ep->state = H_EP_STATUS_IN;     /* Get zero length in status packet */
00063         break;
00064       }
00065 
00066       ep->setupErrCnt++;
00067 
00068       /*
00069        * After a halt condition is encountered or an error is detected by the
00070        * host, a control endpoint is allowed to recover by accepting the next
00071        * SETUP package. If the next Setup package is not accepted, a device
00072        * reset will ultimately be needed.
00073        */
00074 
00075       if ( ( ep->setupErrCnt == 1 ) && ( ep->timeout != 0 ) )
00076       {
00077         USBH_CtlSendSetup( ep );                  /* Retry */
00078         break;
00079       }
00080       USBHEP_TransferDone( ep, result );
00081       break;
00082 
00083 
00084     /* ------- Data IN stage ---------------------------------------------- */
00085     case H_EP_DATA_IN:                /* Data received */
00086       if ( result == USB_STATUS_OK )
00087       {
00088         USBH_CtlSendData( ep, 0 );    /* Send zero length out status packet */
00089         ep->state = H_EP_STATUS_OUT;
00090         break;
00091       }
00092       USBHEP_TransferDone( ep, result );
00093       break;
00094 
00095 
00096     /* ------- Data OUT stage --------------------------------------------- */
00097     case H_EP_DATA_OUT:                 /* Data sent */
00098       if ( result == USB_STATUS_OK )
00099       {
00100         USBH_CtlReceiveData( ep, 0 );   /* Get zero length in status packet */
00101         ep->state = H_EP_STATUS_IN;
00102         break;
00103       }
00104       USBHEP_TransferDone( ep, result );
00105       break;
00106 
00107 
00108     /* ------- Status IN/OUT stage ---------------------------------------- */
00109     case H_EP_STATUS_IN:                /* Status packet received */
00110     case H_EP_STATUS_OUT     :          /* Status packet sent */
00111       USBHEP_TransferDone( ep, result );
00112       break;
00113 
00114 
00115     case H_EP_IDLE:
00116       break;
00117   }
00118 }
00119 
00120 /*
00121  * USBHEP_EpHandler() is called each time a packet has been transmitted
00122  * or recieved on a host channel serving a non-control device endpoint.
00123  */
00124 void USBHEP_EpHandler( USBH_Ep_TypeDef *ep, USB_Status_TypeDef result )
00125 {
00126   switch ( ep->state )
00127   {
00128     case H_EP_DATA_IN:
00129     case H_EP_DATA_OUT:
00130       USBHEP_TransferDone( ep, result );
00131       break;
00132 
00133     default:
00134     case H_EP_IDLE:
00135       break;
00136   }
00137 }
00138 
00139 /*
00140  * USBHEP_TransferDone() is called on transfer completion on all types of
00141  * device endpoints.
00142  */
00143 void USBHEP_TransferDone( USBH_Ep_TypeDef *ep, USB_Status_TypeDef result )
00144 {
00145   int hcnum;
00146   USB_XferCompleteCb_TypeDef callback;
00147 
00148   ep->xferCompleted = true;
00149   ep->xferStatus = result;
00150   ep->state = H_EP_IDLE;
00151 
00152   if ( ep->type == USB_EPTYPE_CTRL )
00153   {
00154     hcnum = ep->setup.Direction == USB_SETUP_DIR_IN ? ep->hcIn : ep->hcOut;
00155 
00156     if ( ep->timeout )
00157       USBTIMER_Stop( ep->hcOut + HOSTCH_TIMER_INDEX );
00158 
00159     ep->xferred   = hcs[ hcnum ].xferred;
00160     ep->remaining = hcs[ hcnum ].remaining;
00161 
00162     hcs[ ep->hcIn ].idle = true;
00163     hcs[ ep->hcOut ].idle = true;
00164 
00165     if ( ep->setup.wLength == 0 )
00166     {
00167       ep->xferred = 0;
00168     }
00169   }
00170   else
00171   {
00172     hcnum = ep->in ? ep->hcIn : ep->hcOut;
00173 
00174     if ( ep->timeout || ep->type == USB_EPTYPE_INTR )
00175       USBTIMER_Stop( hcnum + HOSTCH_TIMER_INDEX );
00176 
00177     hcs[ hcnum ].idle = true;
00178     ep->xferred   = hcs[ hcnum ].xferred;
00179     ep->remaining = hcs[ hcnum ].remaining;
00180   }
00181 
00182   if ( ep->xferCompleteCb )
00183   {
00184     callback = ep->xferCompleteCb;
00185     ep->xferCompleteCb = NULL;
00186     (callback)( result, ep->xferred, ep->remaining );
00187   }
00188 }

00193 #endif /* defined( USB_PRESENT ) && ( USB_COUNT == 1 ) */
